sentences.sContent: Bent double, like old beggars under sacks Knock-kneed, coughing like hags, we cursed through sludge Till on the haunting flares we turned our backs And towards our distant rest began to trudge.
sentences.sContent_eng: Bent double, like old beggars under sacks Knock-kneed, coughing like hags, we cursed through sludge Till on the haunting flares we turned our backs And towards our distant rest began to trudge.
sentences.sCn: 深深地弯下腰，就像压在麻包下的老乞丐,双膝跪下，象丑陋的老太婆在咳嗽，我们用泥巴诅咒,直到闪耀的火光浮现，我们才背转身,向着我们遥远的憩息处开始跋涉。

sentences.sContent: They will trudge along, facing a growing set of roadblocks, until, exhausted, they collapse.
sentences.sContent_eng: They will trudge along, facing a growing set of roadblocks, until, exhausted, they collapse.
sentences.sCn: 他们会一路跋涉，遭遇路上不断出现的一系列障碍，直到筋疲力尽，倒在路上。

sentences.sContent: So, for a variety of reasons, a lot of people trudge through a job they simply cannot stand.
sentences.sContent_eng: So, for a variety of reasons, a lot of people trudge through a job they simply cannot stand.
sentences.sCn: 因此，由于种种原因，许多人在他们简直无法承担的工作中辛苦跋涉。
